Golf & generalize `smul_top_eq_map`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730857)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730644)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730792)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (I : Ideal R) : I â€¢ (âŠ¤ : Submodule R S) = (I.map (algebraMap R S)).restrictScalars R := ```
I think these should be flipped and maybe even be tagged `@[simp]`
And the first lemma arguably belong somewhere else.
I was going for consistency with `smul_top_eq_map`. I agree that simplifying the other way makes sense but this seems backwards from the existing `simp`
I think the simp direction is pushing `restrictScalars` inwards? For example `Submodule.restrictScalars_mul`

But then we have the simp rules `I â€¢ (âŠ¤ : Submodule R S) â†’ (I.map (algebraMap R S)).restrictScalars R` and `(I.map (algebraMap R S) â€¢ N).restrictScalars R â†’ I â€¢ N.restrictScalars R`, which imo seem like they'e going in opposite directions?
Oh I didn't know that was a simp lemma. Maybe just leave them as is for now and mark them later if needed. I still think flipping them is a good idea though.
